race.name: Holly Shelter Gravel Grinder
race.tagline: Coastal plain gravel in southeast North Carolina's Holly Shelter Game Land.

vitals.location: Southeast North Carolina (Holly Shelter Game Land)

climate.description: Variable conditions with heat possible in spring, cool possible in fall, and humidity.

terrain.surface: Gravel roads through Holly Shelter Game Land. Minimal elevation (flat to rolling) with forest and coastal scenery.

gravel_god_rating.score_note: Regional NC event. Coastal plain terrain is flat with minimal elevation and regional field.

biased_opinion.summary: Holly Shelter Gravel Grinder is a regional event in southeast North Carolina's Holly Shelter Game Land. The coastal plain terrain is flat to rolling with minimal elevation, offering forest and coastal scenery. The moderate organization and regional field keep it firmly in Tier 3. Near Wilmington with moderate access. It's a solid regional event for North Carolina cyclists seeking a flat gravel race.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: A solid regional North Carolina gravel race with flat coastal plain terrain. Worth it for NC cyclists seeking a flat gravel event. Not a destination race for out-of-state travelers.

final_verdict.one_liner: Flat coastal plain gravel in southeast North Carolina's Holly Shelter Game Land.
final_verdict.should_you_race: If you're in North Carolina and want a flat gravel event—yes, it's a solid regional race. If you're from out of state—there are better options.
final_verdict.alternatives: For better Southeast events: Gravel Worlds, Pisgah Monster-Cross, Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet. For similar regional events: other NC gravel races.

logistics.lodging_strategy: Wilmington has lodging options. Holly Shelter area has limited options.

course_description.character: Flat to rolling coastal plain gravel.
course_description.signature_challenge: Flat coastal plain gravel in Holly Shelter Game Land.

guide_variables.race_location: Southeast North Carolina (Holly Shelter Game Land)

non_negotiables.why: Flat coastal plain requires sustained effort without climbing breaks.
NC spring/fall means heat and humidity are possible.
Flat terrain requires pacing discipline to avoid burning out.

topics.heat: Racing in NC heat and humidity

marketplace_variables.race_hook: Flat coastal plain gravel in southeast North Carolina's Holly Shelter Game Land.
marketplace_variables.race_hook_detail: Regional event with minimal elevation near Wilmington.

logistics.explanation: Registration opens December 8 with clear pricing structure and strict refund policy—75% refund until November 30, 50% until January 31, then nothing. Race day schedule runs 7:15 AM registration through 12:00 PM awards. However, no lodging partnerships or parking details provided for the Holly Shelter Game Land location.

length.explanation: Official long course at 54.7 miles with 32.5-mile short course option provides solid distance choices for different fitness levels. The mass start combines approximately 180 riders across all distances, creating early congestion but manageable overall field management. Similar distance to Crusher in the Tushar.

technicality.explanation: Course features 'all types of road surfaces' including gravel roads, dirt roads, and both packed and loose sand roads once you enter Holly Shelter Game Land. Organizers note 'a few wet areas depending on what kind of rain we get before the race' with mud holes considered part of the experience. Less technical than The Mid South.

elevation.explanation: Long course delivers only 293 feet of elevation gain over 54.7 miles, with short course at 192 feet over 32.5 miles. Despite official description of 'moderate terrain with rolling short steep hills,' the numbers confirm this is essentially flat coastal riding. Flatter profile than Croatan Buck Fifty.

climate.explanation: Late March timing in coastal North Carolina provides variable spring conditions, with course including wet areas and mud holes that depend on pre-race rainfall. The proximity to Atlantic weather patterns creates unpredictable race day conditions for the Holly Shelter Game Land venue. More weather exposure than Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

altitude.explanation: Holly Shelter Game Land sits at sea level with minimal elevation variation—the 293 feet of total climbing means you never get meaningfully above starting elevation. Zero altitude considerations for this coastal North Carolina location. Lower altitude than Gravel Worlds — no thin-air concerns.

adventure.explanation: Holly Shelter Game Land provides backcountry access through North Carolina's coastal wilderness with varied surface conditions from packed to loose sand roads. The course enters the woods after a short paved section, but the flat terrain limits route-finding challenges.

prestige.explanation: Part of the North Carolina Gravel Series alongside Uwharrie Forest and Dirt Diggler events, produced by Trans-Sylvania Productions. Awards limited to top 3 in each category with no prize purse, positioning it as a regional series event rather than destination race.

race_quality.explanation: Fully stocked aid stations at miles 25 and 47 for long course, with post-race meal starting at 11:00 AM and organized award ceremonies. Registration includes event shirt, Hi-Wire Brewing drink, and well-marked course, though the strict no-transfer policy suggests past organizational challenges.

experience.explanation: Complete package with post-race meal beginning at 11:00 AM, Hi-Wire Brewing drinks, and structured award ceremonies for short course (11:30) and long course (12:00). The varied surface conditions from gravel to sand roads provide tactile variety despite minimal elevation.

community.explanation: Integration with North Carolina Gravel Series creates regional racing community across three annual events. Mass start format with 180 riders promotes group dynamics, while post-race meal timing allows both distance groups to celebrate together.

field_depth.explanation: 2021 short course results show Josh Bennett winning in 1:45:19 with top 10 spread from 1:45 to 2:09, but field spreads significantly to 4:18 for last finisher. The 180-rider total field suggests decent participation without elite competition depth. Less competitive depth than Almanzo 100.

value.explanation: $85 early registration ($95 regular) includes well-marked course, event shirt, post-race meal, Hi-Wire beer, and aid station support. Early bird discount rewards commitment, with race day registration available if not sold out.

expenses.explanation: Registration runs $60-100. Rocky Point, North Carolina location in rural coastal area should provide reasonable lodging and dining costs compared to resort markets. Race insurance 'strongly encouraged' by organizers, but the non-destination location keeps overall trip expenses manageable for regional participants. Similar expense level to Belgian Waffle Ride San Diego.

primary.name: Specialized Pathfinder Pro
primary.why: Fast center, grippy edges. The modern all-rounder benchmark.

primary.name: Panaracer GravelKing SK
primary.why: Affordable all-rounder. Light knobs add grip without killing speed.

primary.name: Vittoria Terreno Mix
primary.why: Graphene versatility. Mixed-terrain grip with reasonable rolling speed.

front_rear_split.rationale: Faster front for reduced rolling resistance on straights, grippier rear for traction on loose climbs and corners
